intro: Arenaria rafinesquiana, commonly known as the sandspurry, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its compact growth habit and ability to store water make it well adapted to drought conditions. It is also valued for its ornamental appeal in rock gardens and xeriscapic landscapes.
